wikipedia_page.main: Frederick Henri Kay Henrion (born Heinrich Fritz Kohn, Nuremberg, Germany) (1914–1990), was a German graphic designer. A celebrated poster and exhibition designer, Henrion was also the founding father of modern European corporate identity.

response: In 1947 she married the graphic designer Henri Kay Henrion but left him in the 1970s. They had two sons and a daughter.
*Frederic Henri Kay Henrion, M.B.E., Graphic Designer.
